field_schema_medicalspecialty_single.name: schema_medicalspecialty_single
field_schema_medicalspecialty_single.label: Medical Specialty, Single (MedicalSpecialty)
field_schema_medicalspecialty_single.instructions:
Select one Schema.org MedicalSpecialty enumeration member that is relevant to this entity. If there is no match, then select "None."

For information on the MedicalSpecialty Schema.org enumeration type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalSpecialty.

For information on each of the MedicalSpecialty Schema.org enumeration members, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalSpecialty#subtypes.

choices.0: None — No available option is relevant to this entity
choices.Anesthesia: Anesthesia — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to study of anesthetics and their application.
choices.Cardiovascular: Cardiovascular — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of heart and vasculature.
choices.CommunityHealth: CommunityHealth — A field of public health focusing on improving health characteristics of a defined population in relation with their geographical or environment areas.
choices.Dentistry: Dentistry — A branch of medicine that is involved in the dental care.
choices.Dermatology: Dermatology — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of skin.
choices.DietNutrition: DietNutrition — Dietetics and nutrition as a medical specialty.
choices.Emergency: Emergency — A specific branch of medical science that deals with the evaluation and initial treatment of medical conditions caused by trauma or sudden illness.
choices.Endocrine: Endocrine — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of endocrine glands and their secretions.
choices.Gastroenterologic: Gastroenterologic — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of digestive system.
choices.Genetic: Genetic — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to hereditary transmission and the variation of inherited characteristics and disorders.
choices.Geriatric: Geriatric — A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with the diagnosis and treatment of diseases, debilities and provision of care to the aged.
choices.Gynecologic: Gynecologic — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to the health care of women, particularly in the diagnosis and treatment of disorders affecting the female reproductive system.
choices.Hematologic: Hematologic — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of blood and blood producing organs.
choices.Infectious: Infectious — Something in medical science that pertains to infectious diseases, i.e. caused by bacterial, viral, fungal or parasitic infections.
choices.LaboratoryScience: LaboratoryScience — A medical science pertaining to chemical, hematological, immunologic, microscopic, or bacteriological diagnostic analyses or research.
choices.Midwifery: Midwifery — A nurse-like health profession that deals with pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period (including care of the newborn), besides sexual and reproductive health of women throughout their lives.
choices.Musculoskeletal: Musculoskeletal — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to diagnosis and treatment of disorders of muscles, ligaments and skeletal system.
choices.Neurologic: Neurologic — A specific branch of medical science that studies the nerves and nervous system and its respective disease states.
choices.Nursing: Nursing — A health profession of a person formally educated and trained in the care of the sick or infirm person.
choices.Obstetric: Obstetric — A specific branch of medical science that specializes in the care of women during the prenatal and postnatal care and with the delivery of the child.
choices.Oncologic: Oncologic — A specific branch of medical science that deals with benign and malignant tumors, including the study of their development, diagnosis, treatment and prevention.
choices.Optometric: Optometric — The science or practice of testing visual acuity and prescribing corrective lenses.
choices.Otolaryngologic: Otolaryngologic — A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with the ear, nose and throat and their respective disease states.
choices.Pathology: Pathology — A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with the study of the cause, origin and nature of a disease state, including its consequences as a result of manifestation of the disease. In clinical care, the term is used to designate a branch of medicine using laboratory tests to diagnose and determine the prognostic significance of illness.
choices.Pediatric: Pediatric — A specific branch of medical science that specializes in the care of infants, children and adolescents.
choices.PharmacySpecialty: PharmacySpecialty — The practice or art and science of preparing and dispensing drugs and medicines
choices.Physiotherapy: Physiotherapy — The practice of treatment of disease, injury, or deformity by physical methods such as massage, heat treatment, and exercise rather than by drugs or surgery.
choices.PlasticSurgery: PlasticSurgery — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to therapeutic or cosmetic repair or re-formation of missing, injured or malformed tissues or body parts by manual and instrumental means.
choices.Podiatric: Podiatric — Podiatry is the care of the human foot, especially the diagnosis and treatment of foot disorders.
choices.PrimaryCare: PrimaryCare — The medical care by a physician, or other health-care professional, who is the patient's first contact with the health-care system and who may recommend a specialist if necessary.
choices.Psychiatric: Psychiatric — A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with the study, treatment, and prevention of mental illness, using both medical and psychological therapies.
choices.PublicHealth: PublicHealth — Branch of medicine that pertains to the health services to improve and protect community health, especially epidemiology, sanitation, immunization, and preventive medicine.
choices.Pulmonary: Pulmonary — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to the study of the respiratory system and its respective disease states.
choices.Radiography: Radiography — Radiography is an imaging technique that uses electromagnetic radiation other than visible light, especially X-rays, to view the internal structure of a non-uniformly composed and opaque object such as the human body.
choices.Renal: Renal — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to the study of the kidneys and its respective disease states.
choices.RespiratoryTherapy: RespiratoryTherapy — The therapy that is concerned with the maintenance or improvement of respiratory function (as in patients with pulmonary disease).
choices.Rheumatologic: Rheumatologic — A specific branch of medical science that deals with the study and treatment of rheumatic, autoimmune or joint diseases.
choices.SpeechPathology: SpeechPathology — The scientific study and treatment of defects, disorders, and malfunctions of speech and voice, as stuttering, lisping, or lalling, and of language disturbances, as aphasia or delayed language acquisition.
choices.Surgical: Surgical — A specific branch of medical science that pertains to treating diseases, injuries and deformities by manual and instrumental means.
choices.Toxicologic: Toxicologic — A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with poisons, their nature, effects and detection and involved in the treatment of poisoning.
choices.Urologic: Urologic — A specific branch of medical science that is concerned with the diagnosis and treatment of diseases pertaining to the urinary tract and the urogenital system.

field_schema_medicalspecialty_multiple.name: schema_medicalspecialty_multiple
field_schema_medicalspecialty_multiple.label: MedicalSpecialty, Multiple (MedicalSpecialty)

For information on the MedicalSpecialty Schema.org enumeration type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalSpecialty.

For information on each of the MedicalSpecialty Schema.org enumeration members, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalSpecialty#subtypes.

field_schema_sameas.name: schema_sameas
field_schema_sameas.label: Reference Webpage(s) About This Entity (sameAs > URL)
field_schema_sameas.instructions:
Reference webpages (e.g., Wikipedia article) or URI-identified RDF class from an external vocabulary (e.g., Wikidata entry, Library of Congress Name Authority File) that unambiguously indicates the entity's identity.

Wikipedia: https://en.wikipedia.org/

Wikidata: https://www.wikidata.org/

Library of Congress Name Authority File: https://id.loc.gov/authorities/names.html

Virtual International Authority File: https://viaf.org/

FAST Authority File: https://experimental.worldcat.org/fast/

sub_fields.name: schema_sameas_url
sub_fields.label: Reference Webpage URI or URL
sub_fields.instructions: Add the URI or permalink if it is available. Otherwise, add the URL.

field_schema_additionalType.name: schema_additionalType
field_schema_additionalType.label: More Specific Type(s) for This Entity From External Vocabularies in Microdata Syntax (additionalType > Text or URL)
field_schema_additionalType.instructions:
The available types on Schema.org are not always the most specific. External vocabularies can be used to associate this entity with a more specific type.

Add the URI-identified RDF class from an external vocabulary (e.g., Wikidata entry, Library of Congress Name Authority File).

Wikidata: https://www.wikidata.org/

Library of Congress Name Authority File: https://id.loc.gov/authorities/names.html

Virtual International Authority File: https://viaf.org/

FAST Authority File: https://experimental.worldcat.org/fast/

field_schema_alternatename.name: schema_alternatename
field_schema_alternatename.label: Alternate Name(s) (alternateName > Text)
field_schema_alternatename.instructions: Acronyms, shortened names or alternate spellings of the entity

field_schema_medicalcode.name: schema_medicalcode
field_schema_medicalcode.label: Medical Code(s) for This Entity (MedicalCode)
field_schema_medicalcode.instructions:
A medical code for the entity, taken from a controlled vocabulary or ontology (e.g., ICD-11, DiseasesDB, MeSH, SNOMED-CT, RxNorm).

For information on the MedicalCode Schema.org type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalCode.

DiseasesDB (Diseases Database): http://www.diseasesdatabase.com/

ICD-10-CM (International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems, Tenth Revision, Clinical Modification): https://icd10cmtool.cdc.gov/ or https://www.icd10data.com/

ICD-10-PCS (International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems, Tenth Revision, Procedure Coding System): https://www.icd10data.com/

ICD-11 (International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems, Eleventh Revision): https://icd.who.int/browse11/

ICHI (International Classification of Health Interventions): https://icd.who.int/dev11/l-ichi/en

ICPC-3 (International Classification of Primary Care, Third Revision): https://browser.icpc-3.info/

MeSH (Medical Subject Headings): https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/mesh/

RxNorm: https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/

SNOMED-CT: https://browser.ihtsdotools.org/

sub_fields.name: schema_medicalcode_codingsystem
sub_fields.label: Coding System (codingSystem > Text)
sub_fields.instructions:
Select from the list of coding systems or enter a custom option.

For information on the codingSystem Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/codingSystem.

sub_fields.name: schema_medicalcode_codevalue
sub_fields.label: Code Value (codeValue > Text)
sub_fields.instructions:
A short textual code that uniquely identifies the value.

For information on the codeValue Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/codeValue.

sub_fields.name: schema_medicalcode_name
sub_fields.label: Name Associated With the Code (name > Text)

sub_fields.name: schema_medicalcode_url
sub_fields.label: URI or URL of the Code Description or Detail Page (url > URL)

field_schema_medicalentity_subtype.name: schema_medicalentity_subtype
field_schema_medicalentity_subtype.label: MedicalEntity Subtype
field_schema_medicalentity_subtype.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of MedicalEntity.

For information on each subtype, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalEntity#subtypes.

choices.AnatomicalStructure: AnatomicalStructure — Any part of the human body, typically a component of an anatomical system. Organs, tissues, and cells are all anatomical structures.
choices.AnatomicalSystem: AnatomicalSystem — An anatomical system is a group of anatomical structures that work together to perform a certain task. Anatomical systems, such as organ systems, are one organizing principle of anatomy, and can include circulatory, digestive, endocrine, integumentary, immune, lymphatic, muscular, nervous, reproductive, respiratory, skeletal, urinary, vestibular, and other systems.
choices.DrugClass: DrugClass — A class of medical drugs, e.g., statins. Classes can represent general pharmacological class, common mechanisms of action, common physiological effects, etc.
choices.DrugCost: DrugCost — The cost per unit of a medical drug. Note that this type is not meant to represent the price in an offer of a drug for sale; see the Offer type for that. This type will typically be used to tag wholesale or average retail cost of a drug, or maximum reimbursable cost. Costs of medical drugs vary widely depending on how and where they are paid for, so while this type captures some of the variables, costs should be used with caution by consumers of this schema's markup.
choices.LifestyleModification: LifestyleModification — A process of care involving exercise, changes to diet, fitness routines, and other lifestyle changes aimed at improving a health condition.
choices.MedicalCause: MedicalCause — The causative agent(s) that are responsible for the pathophysiologic process that eventually results in a medical condition, symptom or sign. In this schema, unless otherwise specified this is meant to be the proximate cause of the medical condition, symptom or sign. The proximate cause is defined as the causative agent that most directly results in the medical condition, symptom or sign. For example, the HIV virus could be considered a cause of AIDS. Or in a diagnostic context, if a patient fell and sustained a hip fracture and two days later sustained a pulmonary embolism which eventuated in a cardiac arrest, the cause of the cardiac arrest (the proximate cause) would be the pulmonary embolism and not the fall. Medical causes can include cardiovascular, chemical, dermatologic, endocrine, environmental, gastroenterologic, genetic, hematologic, gynecologic, iatrogenic, infectious, musculoskeletal, neurologic, nutritional, obstetric, oncologic, otolaryngologic, pharmacologic, psychiatric, pulmonary, renal, rheumatologic, toxic, traumatic, or urologic causes; medical conditions can be causes as well.
choices.MedicalCondition: MedicalCondition — Any condition of the human body that affects the normal functioning of a person, whether physically or mentally. Includes diseases, injuries, disabilities, disorders, syndromes, etc.
choices.MedicalContraindication: MedicalContraindication — A condition or factor that serves as a reason to withhold a certain medical therapy. Contraindications can be absolute (there are no reasonable circumstances for undertaking a course of action) or relative (the patient is at higher risk of complications, but these risks may be outweighed by other considerations or mitigated by other measures).
choices.MedicalDevice: MedicalDevice — Any object used in a medical capacity, such as to diagnose or treat a patient.
choices.MedicalGuideline: MedicalGuideline — Any recommendation made by a standard society (e.g. ACC/AHA) or consensus statement that denotes how to diagnose and treat a particular condition. Note: this type should be used to tag the actual guideline recommendation; if the guideline recommendation occurs in a larger scholarly article, use MedicalScholarlyArticle to tag the overall article, not this type. Note also: the organization making the recommendation should be captured in the recognizingAuthority base property of MedicalEntity.
choices.MedicalIndication: MedicalIndication — A condition or factor that indicates use of a medical therapy, including signs, symptoms, risk factors, anatomical states, etc.
choices.MedicalIntangible: MedicalIntangible — A utility class that serves as the umbrella for a number of 'intangible' things in the medical space.
choices.MedicalProcedure: MedicalProcedure — A medical procedure is a process of care used in either a diagnostic, therapeutic, preventive or palliative capacity that relies on invasive (surgical), non-invasive, or other techniques.
choices.MedicalRiskEstimator: MedicalRiskEstimator — Any rule set or interactive tool for estimating the risk of developing a complication or condition.
choices.MedicalRiskFactor: MedicalRiskFactor — A risk factor is anything that increases a person's likelihood of developing or contracting a disease, medical condition, or complication.
choices.MedicalStudy: MedicalStudy — A medical study is an umbrella type covering all kinds of research studies relating to human medicine or health, including observational studies and interventional trials and registries, randomized, controlled or not. When the specific type of study is known, use one of the extensions of this type, such as MedicalTrial or MedicalObservationalStudy. Also, note that this type should be used to mark up data that describes the study itself; to tag an article that publishes the results of a study, use MedicalScholarlyArticle. Note: use the code property of MedicalEntity to store study IDs, e.g. clinicaltrials.gov ID.
choices.MedicalTest: MedicalTest — Any medical test, typically performed for diagnostic purposes.
choices.Substance: Substance — Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
choices.SuperficialAnatomy: SuperficialAnatomy — Anatomical features that can be observed by sight (without dissection), including the form and proportions of the human body as well as surface landmarks that correspond to deeper subcutaneous structures. Superficial anatomy plays an important role in sports medicine, phlebotomy, and other medical specialties as underlying anatomical structures can be identified through surface palpation. For example, during back surgery, superficial anatomy can be used to palpate and count vertebrae to find the site of incision. Or in phlebotomy, superficial anatomy can be used to locate an underlying vein; for example, the median cubital vein can be located by palpating the borders of the cubital fossa (such as the epicondyles of the humerus) and then looking for the superficial signs of the vein, such as size, prominence, ability to refill after depression, and feel of surrounding tissue support. As another example, in a subluxation (dislocation) of the glenohumeral joint, the bony structure becomes pronounced with the deltoid muscle failing to cover the glenohumeral joint allowing the edges of the scapula to be superficially visible. Here, the superficial anatomy is the visible edges of the scapula, implying the underlying dislocation of the joint (the related anatomical structure).

field_schema_medicalentity_subtype_avail.name: schema_medicalentity_subtype_availableservice
field_schema_medicalentity_subtype_avail.label: MedicalEntity Subtype (availableService)
field_schema_medicalentity_subtype_avail.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of MedicalEntity.

For information on each subtype, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalEntity#subtypes.

choices.MedicalProcedure: MedicalProcedure — A medical procedure is a process of care used in either a diagnostic, therapeutic, preventive or palliative capacity that relies on invasive (surgical), non-invasive, or other techniques.
choices.MedicalTest: MedicalTest — Any medical test, typically performed for diagnostic purposes.

field_schema_medicaltest_subtype.name: schema_medicaltest_subtype
field_schema_medicaltest_subtype.label: MedicalTest Subtype
field_schema_medicaltest_subtype.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of MedicalTest.

For descriptions of each, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalTest#subtypes.

choices.0: None — Either MedicalTest is specific enough or no other subtype option is relevant.
choices.BloodTest: BloodTest — A medical test performed on a sample of a patient's blood.
choices.ImagingTest: ImagingTest — Any medical imaging modality typically used for diagnostic purposes.
choices.MedicalTestPanel: MedicalTestPanel — Any collection of tests commonly ordered together.
choices.PathologyTest: PathologyTest — A medical test performed by a laboratory that typically involves examination of a tissue sample by a pathologist.

field_schema_medicalprocedure_subtype.name: schema_medicalprocedure_subtype
field_schema_medicalprocedure_subtype.label: MedicalProcedure Subtype
field_schema_medicalprocedure_subtype.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of MedicalProcedure.

For descriptions of each, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalProcedure#subtypes.

choices.0: None — Either MedicalProcedure is specific enough or no other subtype option is relevant.
choices.DiagnosticProcedure: DiagnosticProcedure — A medical procedure intended primarily for diagnostic, as opposed to therapeutic, purposes.
choices.PalliativeProcedure: PalliativeProcedure — A medical procedure intended primarily for palliative purposes, aimed at relieving the symptoms of an underlying health condition.
choices.PhysicalExam: Physical Exam — A type of physical examination of a patient performed by a physician.
choices.SurgicalProcedure: SurgicalProcedure — A medical procedure involving an incision with instruments; performed for diagnose, or therapeutic purposes.
choices.TherapeuticProcedure: TherapeuticProcedure — A medical procedure intended primarily for therapeutic purposes, aimed at improving a health condition.

field_schema_therapeuticprocedure_subtyp.name: schema_therapeuticprocedure_subtype
field_schema_therapeuticprocedure_subtyp.label: TherapeuticProcedure Subtype
field_schema_therapeuticprocedure_subtyp.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of TherapeuticProcedure.

For descriptions of each, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/TherapeuticProcedure#subtypes.

choices.0: None — Either TherapeuticProcedure is specific enough or no other subtype option is relevant.
choices.MedicalTherapy: MedicalTherapy — Any medical intervention designed to prevent, treat, and cure human diseases and medical conditions, including both curative and palliative therapies. Medical therapies are typically processes of care relying upon pharmacotherapy, behavioral therapy, supportive therapy (with fluid or nutrition for example), or detoxification (e.g., hemodialysis) aimed at improving or preventing a health condition.
choices.PsychologicalTreatment: PsychologicalTreatment — A process of care relying upon counseling, dialogue and communication aimed at improving a mental health condition without use of drugs.

field_schema_medicaltherapy_subtype.name: schema_medicaltherapy_subtype
field_schema_medicaltherapy_subtype.label: MedicalTherapy Subtype
field_schema_medicaltherapy_subtype.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of MedicalTherapy.

For descriptions of each, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalTherapy#subtypes.

choices.0: None — Either MedicalTherapy is specific enough or no other subtype option is relevant.
choices.OccupationalTherapy: OccupationalTherapy — A treatment of people with physical, emotional, or social problems, using purposeful activity to help them overcome or learn to deal with their problems.
choices.PalliativeProcedure: PalliativeProcedure — A medical procedure intended primarily for palliative purposes, aimed at relieving the symptoms of an underlying health condition.
choices.PhysicalTherapy: PhysicalTherapy — A process of progressive physical care and rehabilitation aimed at improving a health condition.
choices.RadiationTherapy: RadiationTherapy — A process of care using radiation aimed at improving a health condition.
choices.RespiratoryTherapy: RespiratoryTherapy — The therapy that is concerned with the maintenance or improvement of respiratory function (as in patients with pulmonary disease).

field_schema_medicalimagingtechnique.name: schema_medicalimagingtechnique
field_schema_medicalimagingtechnique.label: Imaging Technique Used (MedicalImagingTechnique)
field_schema_medicalimagingtechnique.instructions:
Select the most appropriate MedicalImagingTechnique enumeration member.

For information on the imagingTechnique Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/imagingTechnique.

For information on the MedicalImagingTechnique Schema.org enumeration type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalImagingTechnique.

choices.Radiography: Radiography — Radiography is an imaging technique that uses electromagnetic radiation other than visible light, especially X-rays, to view the internal structure of a non-uniformly composed and opaque object such as the human body.

field_schema_tissuesample.name: schema_tissuesample
field_schema_tissuesample.label: Tissue Sample Type(s) (tissueSample > Text)
field_schema_tissuesample.instructions:
List the tissue sample type(s) required for the test.

For information on the tissueSample Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/tissueSample.

field_schema_medicalcondition.name: schema_medicalcondition
field_schema_medicalcondition.label: Medical Condition(s) (MedicalCondition)
field_schema_medicalcondition.instructions:
Any condition of the human body that affects the normal functioning of a person, whether physically or mentally. Includes diseases, injuries, disabilities, disorders, syndromes, etc.

For information on the MedicalCondition Schema.org type, visit https://schema.org/usedToDiagnose.

field_schema_medicaldevice.name: schema_medicaldevice
field_schema_medicaldevice.label: Object(s) Used in a Medical Capacity, Such As to Diagnose or Treat a Patient (MedicalDevice)
field_schema_medicaldevice.instructions:
For information on the usesDevice Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/usesDevice.

For information on the MedicalDevice Schema.org type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalDevice.

sub_fields.name: schema_medicaldevice_name
sub_fields.label: Name of the Medical Device (name > Text)

sub_fields.name: schema_medicaldevice_alternatename
sub_fields.label: Alternate Name(s) for the Medical Device (alternateName > Text)

sub_fields.name: schema_medicaldevice_code
sub_fields.label: Medical Code(s) for the Medical Device (code > MedicalCode)

field_schema_medicalproceduretype.name: schema_medicalproceduretype
field_schema_medicalproceduretype.label: Type of Procedure (MedicalProcedureType)
field_schema_medicalproceduretype.instructions:
Select the most appropriate MedicalProcedureType.

For information on the medicalProcedureType Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/procedureType.

For information on the MedicalProcedureType Schema.org enumeration type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalProcedureType.

choices.NoninvasiveProcedure: NoninvasiveProcedure — A type of medical procedure that involves noninvasive techniques.
choices.PercutaneousProcedure: PercutaneousProcedure — A type of medical procedure that involves percutaneous techniques, where access to organs or tissue is achieved via needle-puncture of the skin. For example, catheter-based procedures like stent delivery.

field_schema_drugprescriptionstatus.name: schema_drugprescriptionstatus
field_schema_drugprescriptionstatus.label: Drug Prescription Status (DrugPrescriptionStatus)
field_schema_drugprescriptionstatus.instructions:
Indicate whether this drug is available by prescription or over-the-counter.

For information on the DrugPrescriptionStatus Schema.org enumeration type, visit https://schema.org/DrugPrescriptionStatus.

For information on the enumeration members of the DrugPrescriptionStatus Schema.org enumeration type, visit the links at https://schema.org/DrugPrescriptionStatus#subtypes.

field_schema_drug.name: schema_drug
field_schema_drug.label: Chemical or Biologic Substance(s), Used As a Medical Therapy, That Has a Physiological Effect on an Organism (Drug)
field_schema_drug.instructions:
Here the term drug is used interchangeably with the term medicine although clinical knowledge makes a clear difference between them.

For information on the Drug Schema.org type, visit https://schema.org/Drug.

sub_fields.name: schema_drug_proprietaryname
sub_fields.label: Proprietary Name (proprietaryName > Text)
sub_fields.instructions:
Proprietary name(s) given to the drug, typically by its originator(s) or creator(s). Search RxNorm at https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/ to find or confirm this information.

For information on the proprietaryName Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/proprietaryName.

sub_fields.name: schema_drug_nonproprietaryname
sub_fields.label: Generic Name (nonProprietaryName > Text)
sub_fields.instructions:
The generic name(s) of this drug or supplement. Search RxNorm at https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/ to find or confirm this information.

For information on the nonProprietaryName Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/nonProprietaryName.

sub_fields.name: schema_drug_rxcui
sub_fields.label: RxCUI drug identifier from RXNORM (rxcui > Text)
sub_fields.instructions:
Search RxNorm at https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/.

For information on the rxcui Schema.org property, visit https://schema.org/rxcui.

field_schema_medicaltherapy.name: schema_medicaltherapy
field_schema_medicaltherapy.label: Medical Intervention(s) Designed to Prevent, Treat, and Cure Human Diseases and Medical Conditions, Including Both Curative and Palliative Therapies (MedicalTherapy)

field_schema_medicalcondition_subtype.name: schema_medicalcondition_subtype
field_schema_medicalcondition_subtype.label: MedicalCondition Subtype
field_schema_medicalcondition_subtype.instructions:
Select the most appropriate subtype of MedicalCondition.

For information on the Schema.org MedicalCondition type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalCondition.

For information on each subtype, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicalCondition#Subtypes.

choices.0: None — No available option is relevant to this entity
choices.InfectiousDisease: InfectiousDisease — An infectious disease is a clinically evident human disease resulting from the presence of pathogenic microbial agents, like pathogenic viruses, pathogenic bacteria, fungi, protozoa, multicellular parasites, and prions. To be considered an infectious disease, such pathogens are known to be able to cause this disease.
choices.MedicalSignOrSymptom: MedicalSignOrSymptom — Any feature associated or not with a medical condition. In medicine a symptom is generally subjective while a sign is objective.

field_schema_infectiousagent.name: schema_infectiousagent
field_schema_infectiousagent.label: Infectious Agent (infectiousAgent > Text)
field_schema_infectiousagent.instructions:
Indicate the name of the actual infectious agent, such as a specific bacterium.

For information on the Schema.org infectiousAgent property, visit https://schema.org/infectiousAgent
field_schema_infectiousagent.placeholder: e.g., severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2

field_schema_infectiousagentclass.name: schema_infectiousagentclass
field_schema_infectiousagentclass.label: Infectious Agent Class (InfectiousAgentClass)
field_schema_infectiousagentclass.instructions:
Select the class of agents or pathogens that transmits this infectious disease.

For information on the Schema.org InfectiousAgentClass enumeration type, visit https://schema.org/InfectiousAgentClass.

For information on each enumeration member, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/InfectiousAgentClass#subtypes.

choices.0: None — No available option is relevant to this entity
choices.Bacteria: Bacteria — Pathogenic bacteria that cause bacterial infection.
choices.MulticellularParasite: MulticellularParasite — Multicellular parasite that causes an infection.
choices.Prion: Prion — A prion is an infectious agent composed of protein in a misfolded form.
choices.Protozoa: Protozoa — Single-celled organism that causes an infection.
choices.Virus: Virus — Pathogenic virus that causes viral infection.

field_schema_nucc_single.name: schema_nucc_single
field_schema_nucc_single.label: Classifications and Specializations From the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set (MedicalCode)
field_schema_nucc_single.instructions:
Select one or more provider classifications and/or specializations from the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set that are relevant to this entity. This will be used in the MedicalCode Schema.org type.

For information on the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set, visit https://taxonomy.nucc.org/.

To easily select the proper item, copy the 10-character code for the desired taxonomy item, paste it into this input, and select the item that is returned.

For information on the MedicalCode Schema.org type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalCode.

field_schema_nucc_multiple.name: schema_nucc_multiple
field_schema_nucc_multiple.label: Matching Classification(s) and/or Specialization(s) From the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set, Multiple (MedicalCode)
field_schema_nucc_multiple.instructions:
Select one or more provider classifications and/or specializations from the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set that match / are relevant this entity. This will be used in the MedicalCode Schema.org type.

For information on the Health Care Provider Taxonomy Code Set, visit https://taxonomy.nucc.org/.

To easily select the proper item, copy the 10-character code for the desired taxonomy item, paste it into this input, and select the item that is returned.

For information on the MedicalCode Schema.org type, visit https://schema.org/MedicalCode.

field_schema_medicinesystem.name: schema_medicinesystem
field_schema_medicinesystem.label: Related System(s) of Medical Practice (MedicineSystem)
field_schema_medicinesystem.instructions:
Select one or more Schema.org MedicineSystem enumeration members that identify the system(s) of medical practice relevant to this entity. If there is no match, then select "None."

For information on the MedicineSystem Schema.org enumeration type, visit https://schema.org/MedicineSystem.

For information on each of the MedicineSystem Schema.org enumeration members, visit the relevant page linked at https://schema.org/MedicineSystem#subtypes.

choices.0: None — No available option is relevant to this entity
choices.Ayurvedic: Ayurvedic — A system of medicine that originated in India over thousands of years and that focuses on integrating and balancing the body, mind, and spirit.
choices.Chiropractic: Chiropractic — A system of medicine focused on the relationship between the body's structure, mainly the spine, and its functioning.
choices.Homeopathic: Homeopathic — A system of medicine based on the principle that a disease can be cured by a substance that produces similar symptoms in healthy people.
choices.Osteopathic: Osteopathic — A system of medicine focused on promoting the body's innate ability to heal itself.
choices.TraditionalChinese: TraditionalChinese — A system of medicine based on common theoretical concepts that originated in China and evolved over thousands of years, that uses herbs, acupuncture, exercise, massage, dietary therapy, and other methods to treat a wide range of conditions.
choices.WesternConventional: WesternConventional — The conventional Western system of medicine, that aims to apply the best available evidence gained from the scientific method to clinical decision making. Also known as conventional or Western medicine.

field_schema_localbusiness_single.name: schema_localbusiness_single
field_schema_localbusiness_single.label: LocalBusiness Subtype
field_schema_localbusiness_single.instructions:
Select the LocalBusiness type that most closely matches this location. If there is no match, then select "None."

For information on each type, visit https://schema.org/.

choices.0: None — No available option is relevant to this entity
choices.MedicalClinic: MedicalClinic — A facility, often associated with a hospital or medical school, that is devoted to the specific diagnosis and/or healthcare. Previously limited to outpatients but with evolution it may be open to inpatients as well.

field_schema_google_cid.name: schema_google_cid
field_schema_google_cid.label: Google CID Number
field_schema_google_cid.instructions:
A Google customer ID (CID) is a unique number used to identify an entity in Google My Business. Follow these steps to locate the CID for this entity's Google My Business listing.

  1. Find the listing on Google Maps.
  2. Click "Share" and copy the link.
  3. Go to the link in the browser.
  4. Copy the resulting full URL.
  5. Go to https://pleper.com/index.php?do=tools&sdo=cid_converter.
  6. Paste the full URL into the "CID or Link to maps" field.
  7. Click "Convert and generate."
  8. Copy the value from the "CID decimal" field.

Once you've done that, paste the value into this field.

field_schema_google_cid_multiple.name: schema_google_cid_multiple
field_schema_google_cid_multiple.label: Google CID Numbers
field_schema_google_cid_multiple.instructions:
A Google customer ID (CID) is a unique number used to identify an entity in Google My Business. Follow these steps to locate the CID for each of this entity's Google My Business listings.

  1. Find the listing on Google Maps.
  2. Click "Share" and copy the link.
  3. Go to the link in the browser.
  4. Copy the resulting full URL.
  5. Go to https://pleper.com/index.php?do=tools&sdo=cid_converter.
  6. Paste the full URL into the "CID or Link to maps" field.
  7. Click "Convert and generate."
  8. Copy the value from the "CID decimal" field.

Once you've done that, paste the value into this field.

field_schema_brandorg_query.label: Primary Brand Organization for This Entity
field_schema_brandorg_query.name: schema_brandorg_query

choices.0: Use the Default UAMS Brand Organization
choices.1: Replace the Default UAMS Brand Organization With a Third-Party Brand Organization

field_schema_brandorg.label: Third-Party Brand Organization
field_schema_brandorg.name: schema_brandorg
field_schema_brandorg.instructions: Select the most specific third-party brand organization to associate with this entity.

field_schema_nonprofitstatus.label: Nonprofit Status (nonprofitStatus > USNonprofitType)
field_schema_nonprofitstatus.name: schema_nonprofitstatus
field_schema_nonprofitstatus.instructions: nonprofitStatus indicates the legal status of a nonprofit organization in its primary place of business.
